title: Fundraiser
description: Andy confronts Robert for the first time after losing the manager position and quitting his job at a fund raiser sponsored by Angela's husband.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [pacing back and forth.] No, no, no, no, no, no, no! No, no, no, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay fine. Ryan, something the matter?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Smokey's dead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Smokey, the bear?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Smokey Robinson Pam. He died like an hour ago, I guess I'm the first to know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow That's terrible, I really liked him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh you liked him? That's nice. Did you like when he changed the course of American music like two or three times? Did you like that tracks of my tears is maybe the last true love song ever written? I'm glad you liked him Jim. I am completely devastated right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I second that emotion.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I know a few of his songs, but what were his big ones?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh God, Nellie! What wasn't his? I mean, um, "Tracks of my Tears"?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yeah

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um... God, so many, Nellie!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, no, "Tracks of My Tears" and what else? What are some more? What's one more?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, I'm not... I'm not playing this game, Pam. Not today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think you love Smokey Robinson. I think you're just doing all of this to prove how deep you are about music

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, I'm sorry I'm not a fan of Jason Mraz or the Beatles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't like the Beatles?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's... That's not the point!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eleanor Rigby? Paperback writer?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, you know, you always think you have time to see these legends before they go. What was I so busy doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It says here this Smokey Robinson dead thing was a hoax. It's on CNN as of two minutes ago.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay well, that's a relief!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! Look at that! It says he's actually playing State College. That's only three hours away!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, Ryan! That's perfect! You have to go!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tickets are 250 bucks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 250 dollars is nothing to the world's biggest Smokey Robinson fan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah... Who's opening?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Paul Anka.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Paul Anka?! How can they make the Smoke Man play with someone like that? I don't think I can see this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you could just show up late though.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How much is parking, like 30 bucks? That's not what Smokey would have wanted. Does want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tears of a clown!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don't call me a clown, Pam. You're better than that!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Looking good, RC!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ugh, I hate ties! I feel like I'm being strangled like I'm at some erotic asphyxiation sex club over on I-84. The red room say? Or Dominick's?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Robert! The senator was going to wear dark brown tonight... I'm sure it will be fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My husband is sponsoring a fundraiser tonight for local dog shelters! Robert California bought two tables for everyone here! These people were lucky to get seats because it is going to be a who's who of the northern 22nd district!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't want to alarm people, but there is a distinct chance that we are all about to be killed

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, as long as you don't want to alarm people...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is a disgruntled ex-employee sitting in his car in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh that's Andy. He's just hanging out

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's how workplace tragedies always begin. A middle aged white male "hanging out". Call the cops!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, I don't think he's going to hurt anybody.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: How do you? I mean, why do you think he's there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't even know what kind of weapon he has. Could be a knife, could be a gun. Could be a series of guns all lined up to shoot parallel. I'm going up to the roof. [Grabs bag.] And I'm gonna bring my gym bag just in case.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I knew this would happen! Everybody told me if I moved to America, I'd be murdered.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, just wanted to say hi and hear you say everything is normal. Maybe video tape you saying that so that everyone upstairs can see.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We think you might kill Robert.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: because he fired you which means apparently you're living in your car now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: guys, everything is fine! I'm just here to pick up Erin. We're going to the Fundraiser.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, great! That sounds good!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, what? You're going to the fundraiser tonight? That's going to be weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would that be weird?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's going to be super weird, he just fired you last week.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy's just coming as my date.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, I hear you! I hope you're right. It just seems like it's going to be really, really weird.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [hears knocks on door.] Come in!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You really re-did Andy's office, huh?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes, cut out the clutter. Very simple, very minimal.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I need you to sign these, we got a shipment going out.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: How are things in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You could go downstairs and ask them?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The warehouse isn't downstairs? [laughs.] Is it? Is it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who knew, right?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [speechless.] I...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Tonight could be the night that Darryl and I go from casual work friends to actual good friends. The only thing standing in our way is the contempt he seems to feel for me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Robert, the senator and I wanted to stop by and say hello.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello! Did anyone order a blast from the past, with a side order of sexy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh man, this is weird!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew. [Robert extends his hand.]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, Wanna shake my hand, huh? Cause I want to shake your body! [hugs Robert and laughs.] I had you, I had you!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [points back and forth at the multiple cameras] Where do I look? It's been so long since I did one of these things? Okay, alright! What's the question? How am I doing? Umm... Great!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Creed, I just bid twenty dollars on six Jiu-Jitsu lessons. No one's raping this guy!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well, I don't want to get raped [picks up clipboard] Twenty-Two!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No! It was my idea to not be raped!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight enters] Wait, you think Jiu-Jitsu classes cost $22 [grabs clipboard.] If you're going to guess the price, you might as well try to be halfway accurate. $180!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa, Dwight, I don't think you understand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You guess the price, you win the prize. Have you never been to a Quaker fair before? God!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So Dwight doesn't understand silent auctions. I guess he's the stupid guy in the office, huh? Up till now, we didn't have one!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What haven't I been doing? Gosh, just today I was working on this rock opera that I'm writing, though it feels more like I'm receiving it than writing it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that's exciting! But until you firm up the idea, you might want to keep it between us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The hero lives in this dystopian future and he flies around in a spaceship that's shaped like a treble clef. And he has to sing his heart out to destroy all evil.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sounds like you're doing alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ehh, a little better than alright, actually. Really good!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, this guy is having a breakdown.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: You know, Oscar, I really had no idea you were so passionate about animals.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: my dog Gerald is my life.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: really? Well, if you want to get involved, call me. This is my cell. I'm more likely to pick up night, say after 9... Excuse me. [Walks away.]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This confirms three things: I'm right about the senator, I still got it, and poor Angela.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [telling story to Nellie.] I stepped in right away and start-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bobby! Bobbo! You're a rock opera guy, right? You like rock operas?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You gotta check out this thing I'm working on, it's really cool. There's this character Thomas Oregon, and he wants to destroy all the guitars in the world because he realizes that music is the one thing he can't control.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: So, Thomas Oregon is an evil figure?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Evil! [chuckles.] although he's humanized in the end because he weeps uncontrolably and pees in his pants.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: and the hero, who's that based on?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Me, I guess. [sings.] We're flying so high, we're crackin' the sky! Gonna fly out of this dome my girlfriend and I!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey jabroni. Show some class.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: She's right, Andy. you're being a jabroni

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're being a Thomas Oregon!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew, I think this may have been a bad idea. Why don't you let me pay for you and Erin to go out to a great romantic dinner tonight?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't need you to pay for me. I'm doing just fine, thank you. Why don't you quit harshing our mellow?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy you should leave. Now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Waiter.] Excuse me. I would like to purchase two seats at another table, please.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.text: I'm sorry, the tables are sold as complete units.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: then I'll take a table!

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.text: Okay

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And a high five! [Raises hand, misses high five with waiter.] Oh, let's do this again!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [waiter is cracking pepper into Andys salad] Oh, yes indeed... When! [Waiter begins walking away.] Whoa, whoa, whoa! You forgot a few salads! [waiter peppers another salad.] When!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I stumbled into a very dramatic situation. Angelas husband just hit on me!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I know!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, what? Come on!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We were talking about animals, he gives me his cell phone number. He was just dying for me to have it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Oscar, I'm not saying you're not dreamy, because you are, but isn't it possible that he was just schmoosing a voter?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, if you would have seen the look he gave me, he wanted to run more than just my vote.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, what was this look? [Oscar does the look.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened, did he do it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you- Twice! For real?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay guys, not every glance means something, alright? Life isn't Downton Abbey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Life is Downton Abbey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to go over there and I'm going to talk to him and I guarantee you he gives out his cell phone to everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone.] How much do you guys charge for a one full year gym membership? Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's $475! Like candy from a baby!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey... David Wallace!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Andy Bernard!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, how are you?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: How you doing, I'm great! How you doing, are you still with Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, got canned last week.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, best thing that ever happened to me.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: That's the attitude to have. You know what, when I got canned, I was lost, right? I poured myself into this ridiculous vacuum for toys called Suck-It.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yikes!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah, exactly right? Then suddenly out of nowhere, the US military bought the patent from me for twenty million dollars! The point is, forget those guys, k? Move on! Good to see you, Andy!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Call me a lame man, but I wish there was some real food here. You know, like hamburgers... Or Oreos... Or a pizza pie or, what's another food that we like?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Tacos.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What I wouldn't give for a big mess of tacos right now!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I can go get us some tacos.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Brilliant!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If you loan me some money.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes, I can do that. For, um, for two tacos, we'd probably need about what 20... $20? Or $25? $20?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I've never eaten a taco. I'm not entirely sure what they are. As long as they're not slimy, and please god don't let them have eyes!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Jim shakes Senators hand, returns to table.] So?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Boom! [hands Oscar a business card.]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is interesting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: what is interesting? I just proved that he gives his cell out to everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Or you proved that he thinks you're gay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He does not think Jim's gay. A gay man would not leave the house wearing those shoes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, a gay man would not leave the store wearing those shoes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey! you bought me those shoes!

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: Before we bring out our guest of honor tonight, we are very proud to introduce a great philanthropist and a great guy. Robert California!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Thank you. Why do we love dogs? Want me to tell you why? There is no answer. Our love for them confounds reason!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: can you believe this guy?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The state senator, Robert Lipton, loves dogs. he asked me if I loved dogs. you know what I said? Yes! [laughter.]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not a joke. That was not even a joke.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Bella here was a therapy dog for ten years. when her owner passed away she came to this organization for placement. But people don't often adopt older dogs, so Bella and eleven heroes like her are being cared for by our generous volunteers because frankly nobody else will

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I will! I will take all of those dogs!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, that's very kind-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, no, no. This guy can talk and talk all he wants, but it's not that complicated.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy why don't we discuss this at a-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, no, no, it's about being there for someone after it's become inconvenient for them to be around. Hello everyone, I am Andy Bernard and I am going to take that bitch home! That is a female dog reference. [Points at himself] This bitch understands loyalty! Sassy human reference [grabs dog] thank you, I will take Bella and every single one of her friends!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Mr. Bernard, right this way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay! Hope you all learned something!

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: Huey is going to need this medication once every 90 minutes. You can administer it orally, but he's going to puke it up. So, other end is best. Don't split up Daisy and Mojo because daisy will start to, uh... I was going to say bark, but it's more of a scream.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm so ready to love all of these animals. This one's even bonding with me already.

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: Uh, no. Kenny's a therapy dog. He apparently thinks you're in some kind of emotional crisis.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stupid dog.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Well, if you would like to talk about this some more, my office is always open! So here's my office number, and my cell number.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, looks like he really did just want to talk about the issues. i'm Sorry Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: sorry about what? There's nothing to be sorry about here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No. I'm certainly not disappointed that Angelas husband was not hitting on me. I'd have to be a monster to root for that. A lonely, aging monster.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Tacos were on sale, eight for $3!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, great! Okay, oh... Oh, these tacos!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mmm! Uhh [Eats Taco incorrectly.] Mmmm... Oh! Hmmph!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: She's trying.

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: The winner of the three day trip to the sky top lodge is Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [applause] Yes! Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: The yearlong membership to Scraton-Bikram Yoga is Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [applause] Oh yes! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: A one hour appointment with the kissing magician goes to Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [applause] Oh, oh, oh! Yeah! Ha, ha!

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: Well, I think I can save us some time, Dwight Schrute has won every single item here!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you very much! All I had to do was look at the prices, idiots! Suck it!

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: Well, Dwight, yes! You certainly are a record breaker! Your donation is the largest we've ever received at over 34 thousand dollars! [applause]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Speech! Speech! Speech! Speech!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. Wow, I can't tell you what an honor it is to support this thing... And obviously that amount of money is no concern to me whatsoever. But, I want to ask you something: when did it become all about the money. when did it become about the flower arrangements, and the white wine spritser, hmm? and all the dinner rolls. you people should be ashamed of yourselves! How many courses did we have tonight, two? Three maybe, if you choose the pudding? I mean what waste! these tables tarted up like Victorian whores! lets' remember we are all here for the dog society. He's what's important, whatever his name is. Not any of this. So that is going to be my donation to you. Thank you and good night! [throws microphone and runs away]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nice to see you again, it was lovely!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: It was lovely! And don't forget to call.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: okay

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: thanks so much for coming

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: why does this always happen to me? Ahh! I just feel so bad for Angela

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [applying diaper to dog.] so it just goes on under here like this?

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: that's right!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ugh, oh god!

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: Yeah, you never get used to that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, just wanted to check in. See how you are doing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am so great!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's great. we're all great. Twelve dogs. This my life now, I'm a dog nurse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look at that one though, he's smiling!

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: Yeah, he should be! It's his first day without a muzzle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is the greatest thing that has ever happened to me

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Absolutely, it's awesome-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm sorry, are you guys nuts? He's not doing great! He was fired! This is terrible! This is literally the worst thing that has ever happened to you, not the best.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're right. he's right, I am a mess. This whole night I've been trying to convince you guys that I'm fine. I guess I thought that if I could convince you that I'm fine, maybe-

quotes.speaker: Vet
quotes.text: Maybe you would think it too! [silence.] I'm sorry, it's just I don't get to be in a lot of human conversations.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay well, Andy, listen. It's okay if you don't feel totally settled. This is all very fresh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, admitting you need help is the first step!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! And also, focusing on the positive. Like I got a lot of good things going on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah! Like that rock opera! You could always do that right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I do. I have that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're going to be alright

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. No he's not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, I am! Thank you, Kev!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You're welcome!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sometimes I feel like every one I work with is an idiot. and by sometimes I mean all times. All the times. Every of the times!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So some of us ended up adopting those elderly dogs. It's been great!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Pepper's been getting me out of the house, going on runs.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My dog Ruby doesn't do anything, she just lays there all day! She's so chill.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you feed her?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well I put out Pro Bow-Wow, but she barely touches it. She's so dainty!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Is she sick? How are her poops?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Doesn't really poop. It's perfect, nothing to pick up! She just kind of lies there all day like a good girl. I put on the TV for her, but I have to prop her eyes open so she can see it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Does she smell?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She smells horrible. It's unbelievable. But I don't want to put her in the bath, because I'm afraid that she'll drown.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: People seem awful interested in you Ruby. Guess they're just jealous, right! [dog licks Kevins face.] Yeah, that a girl, that a girl! Man that stinks!
